meanings.definition: Move or cause to move rapidly to and fro.
meanings.sent1: The dog's tail would wag happily when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent2: She could see the flag wagging in the wind from afar.
meanings.sent3: The wind made the scarecrow's arms wag comically.
meanings.sent4: The metronome's pendulum would wag back and forth with precision.
meanings.sent5: The excited child would wag his finger at the colorful butterflies.

meanings.definition: A person who makes jokes or witty remarks.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the class wag for his funny stories.
meanings.sent2: The office wag always had a clever quip ready for any situation.
meanings.sent3: The family reunion was full of laughter thanks to the witty wag.
meanings.sent4: She was the wag of the group, always lightening the mood with humor.
meanings.sent5: The comedy show featured a talented wag who had the audience in stitches.
